messages.title: A Strong Voice for North East Fife
messages.content: Wendy has the experience and energy to be our next MP. Wendy served in the police for twelve years. She then went to work for the Ministry of Defence, helping ex-servicemen and women find work. Wendy, who lives in Fife with her family, is an experienced manager who helps employers and wants to bring back North East Fife residents. Wendy's extensive experience means she will be an MP who will deliver real change for our communities.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Successfully campaigned to save GP out-of-hours services in St Andrews.
Worked with others to bring back clear investment for a new Madras College to be built and campaign for new rail links.
Championing new local developments and services for busy rural communities, support for the Tay Bridgehead.

mentions.tacticalSituation: North East Fife is the closest election race anywhere in the UK! Only two votes separated SNP and the Liberal Democrats last time. This election is no different. Wendy Chamberlain is the only candidate who can bring back North East Fife from the SNP.

issues.health: Successfully campaigned to save GP out-of-hours services in St Andrews.
issues.labourEmployment: Helping ex-servicemen and women find work.

community.content: Championing new local developments and services for busy rural communities, support for the Tay Bridgehead.

leaflet.personalStatement: Wendy will work hard as your MP to demand better for North East Fife.

politicalExperience.achievements: Helped ex-servicemen and women find work.

endorsements.endorsement: Only two votes separated the SNP and Lib Dems last time. It’s clear that Wendy is the only person who can stop the SNP winning here again.
You can always trust the Liberal Democrats to stand up for North East Fife. I think Wendy Chamberlain and Willie Rennie will make a great team for our area.
As a former police officer, Wendy understands the importance of supporting the local communities. I think she will make a first-class MP.

images.caption: Wendy Chamberlain campaigning with local residents.

Wendy has the experience and energy to be our next MP.
